fundamental adjective
(IN MUSIC)
music
  specialized In a fundamental chord (= a group of notes played together), the basic note that identifies the chord (= tells you which one it is) is its lowest note: The value of each chord is determined by its relationship to one, unchangeable fundamental chord. The fall of a semitone is accompanied by the fundamental chord, held for two bars.

the basic note of a chord (= a group of notes played together), which identifies it (= tells you which chord it is): There is a feeling that chords are built up from, or reach down towards, a fundamental. The harmonic series derived from a given note is a set tone consisting of its fundamental tone and upper harmonic tones. Harmonics may be sounded independently of the fundamental note.
More examplesFewer examplesThere will be inevitable differences of intonation between notes produced as a first overtone, second overtone, or as a fundamental. The musical tones that we commonly hear are constituted of a number of tones - the fundamental and its overtones.
